conclusion: Use the ideal gas law, PV = nRT, and properties of transformations in the p-V diagram.
From A to B: Isochoric process; From B to C: Isobaric process.
Pressure at A, P_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa; Volume at A, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Volume at B, V_B = V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3; Pressure at B, P_B = 1 x 10^5 Pa.
Pressure at C, P_C = P_B = 1 x 10^5 Pa; Volume at C, V_C = 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Using the ideal gas law at A and C: P_A V_A = nRT_A and P_C V_C = nRT_C.
Eliminate nR to find relationship: P_A V_A / T_A = P_C V_C / T_C.
Substitute known values into the equation.
The temperature of the gas at state C is 300 K.
